security: Disclosing operational details like cover stories, contact methods, and financial arrangements could expose ongoing intelligence activities and endanger individuals involved. Quoting directly: 'Your initial contact in Havana will be with IDEN A...you will identify yourself as Fred Morse' and 'Your cover story will be...on the behalf of some (unnamed) American businessmen'.
summary: This memo outlines the operational procedures and cover story for Mr. Tichborn's mission in Havana, Cuba, including contact protocols, expense accounting, and the overall objective of gathering political intelligence.
summary_one_paragraph: This memo, addressed to Mr. Tichborn, details his mission to Havana, Cuba, where he will pose as a tourist and later as a representative of unnamed American businessmen to assess the political situation, particularly the opposition groups. The memo outlines contact procedures with IDEN A, instructions for expense reporting using both a true name and a pseudonym (Henry W. Darkin), and the use of a cover company letter as a plausible explanation if questioned by Cuban authorities. The overall objective is to gather information on the strengths, weaknesses, plans, and potential coalescence of opposition groups in Cuba.
title: Clarification of Mission and Procedures for Mr. Tichborn in Cuba
